info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 4:41PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Berks and northeastern Chester Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 441 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Reading, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Reading, Phoenixville, Coatesville, Wyomissing, Birdsboro, Sinking Spring, Laureldale, Elverson, New Morgan, Spring Ridge, Pughtown, Lionville-Marchwood, Glenmoore, Chester Springs, Lionville, Cedarville, Stowe, Shillington, West Reading and Mount Penn. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 296 and 315. Interstate 176 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 1 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
